intro: Monophyllanthe oligophylla, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and is typically found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
